Reviews.Title: “barely clean, tiny, and poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Lauraholl
Reviews.Content: Cheap is right. outdated furniture, no space for suitcases. if we hadnt been upgraded to a 3 bed room instead of the twin, we wouldnt have had any space to open the suitcases except on our own beds. bathroom was tiny and there was nowhere to put your toothbrush even! at least the shower had a glass screen so water didnt get everywhere, but the water often swapped between cold and too hot. wasn't fun. the walls were chipped and didn't look very clean, althought the beds themselves seemed clean and they cleaned the room every day. breakfast was very poor. cornflakes, toast with jam or one type of cheese, juice, coffee, and boiled eggs with black yolks was all that was on offer. we were kinda glad we left too early for breakfast our second morning. no free internet, but you can buy wifi in the room, or pay to use one of two shared computers, but no printing available, despite what the hotel info says in the room. less than 5 minutes walk to Earl's Court station (but be careful, the lifts aren't clearly signed on the picadilly line floor and they are hidden behind stairs so unless you know where they are you'll think there aren't any)

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Kevinshep
Reviews.Content: We stayed in march 2012 room was dirty carpet was dirty rubbish under bed bathroom door couldn't open too close to the bed lead for tele broken. Breakfast was very bad cold coffee toaster was turned up full but failed to toast. Our window had a brickwall outside it. We even woke up with bites on our backs and arms.Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MilenP
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights from 8-11 March. Great location as the Earl's Court tube station is literally round the corner. Nice and plentiful breakfast, though the breakfast premises get crowded after 8.00. The thing we (a company of 6) liked best was the very friendly and cooperative staff. Quite and peaceful street and surroundings. Small rooms but I didn't expect anything different as I've been to such type of hotels in Kensington and Fulham several times. Anyway you don't spend much of your time in a hotel when you're in London, do you? Totally recommendable for a quite reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT return”
Reviews.Author: Anne M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing.Hotel blog was very misleading-picture of room shown had good space This was not the case. Our room was cramped and bed sizes were very small.The beds,covers and floor covering were of poor quality. Corridors were narrow and meant passing sideways particularly at lift area where sheets and towels obstructed pathway and were a hazard.Breakfast consisted of cornflakes,toast,sliced cheddar and boiled egg. Breakfast area was cramped and involved waiting for table to be cleaned and cleared.5pounds luggage charge. Would NOTrecommend.Couple

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not anything special”
Reviews.Author: JMH026 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The rooms and beds are reasonable, clean but dated. The triple room we had, was actually too small for three people. There were only three beds with tables, no seating area, etc. There is no bar where you can have a drink in the evening. So with children younger than 16, after 21.00h you may no longer in stay a pub, and so you should sit in your room, on your beds ... The breakfast was fine, plenty of choice, although the restaurant was cramped and very hot. The hotel's location is ideal: shops in the immediate area and the Earls Court tube station is literally around the corner, a 3-minute walk away. Ideal to explore the rest of London. Furthermore: the hotel is situated in a quiet area, no (noise) pollution. The service of the staff is really fantastic: friendly, always willing to help, suggestions etc. With that in mind, the mentioned ' disadvantages ' are more than compensated. The Oxford Hotel is a definite must, if you do not have too high demands, and have a low budget.

Reviews.Title: “For Â£30 pppn, not bad!”
Reviews.Author: lilyfleur88
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but provided you're not going to be staying in them very long that isn't a problem. Breakfast was good, staff were friendly and the location is great as it's just round the corner from Earl's Court station. It's just a shame they did 't warn you in advance that there's a Â£50 deposit to pay on arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Catherine H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES - Best thing about this hotel was it's location, it was very handy for the museums & the Piccadilly line, the tube station was just a 2 minute walk away. The chap who was on reception when we arrived & during the day was great! very friendly, helpful & informative. The room safe was free & it worked. The tv worked. The hairdryer worked as long as you kept it on the low setting, otherwise it cut out. The sheets & the towels were clean. The shower was warm. I'm afraid that's where the positives end. NEGATIVES - We had a room for 3, myself, my hubby & my son who is just 7. The room was very small, narrow and very basic. The plain magnolia paintwork was scuffed, the carpet was stained, sticky & looked dirty, the windows & window frames were covered with black mould. There were 3 'single' beds, I say single but they were only a little over 2 feet wide, and my husband who is 5' 11" had his feet dangling out of the end. The "wardrobe" & clothes storage area was piteously inadequate for 3 people if you planned to stay for more than 1 or 2 nights. The mini fridge never got cool. According to the hotel details the room was supposed to have a sitting area, this comprised of one canteen type chair stuck in a corner. There was a large mirror on the wall, but no dressing table or even a shelf for you to put your cosmetics on. I ended up using the 'canteen' chair in the 'sitting area'. One of the wall lights didn't work. The tea/coffee/kettle tray was on a storage area above the fridge, but there was no socket to plug it into, so we ended up having to put it on the floor next to the nearest plug socket. Not ideal when you have a boisterous 7 year old in the room! The bathroom was pretty average, it could have done with a good scrub and the shower leaked all over the floor so we had to bung toilet tissue into corners of the shower tray where it hadn't been sealed properly, and there was no bath mat. The breakfast room was self service, basic & chaotic! You had to fight for a table, then battle with all the other grumpy looking tourists to help yourself to the breakfast which comprised of bread rolls or toast (the toaster we used barely warmed the bread even when I put it through twice) cornflakes, boiled eggs, slices of cheese, orange juice, coffee/tea, jam. I was going to complain but couldn't muster up the strength....I suppose it's what you can expect in London, unless you're prepared to open up your wallet and pay through the nose for something better.

Reviews.Title: “Quite ok”
Reviews.Author: 1981Girltraveller
Reviews.Content: It was quite ok to stay there, definately close to the centre. the room was not very big but spacious. It was clean and comfortable, the staff tried really hard to help out. The breakfast wasn't also the worst, many thigs to chose from and even tasty. Some people were disturbed y towels lying in the hall but I didn;t mind. Tesco and Sainsbury quite close, Marks&Spencer food store just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: danielson81
Reviews.Content: This hotel was ok, it was cheap and was very near a tube station. The room was very small, however it was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was a bit of a free for all downstairs, there were not spare cups/plates etc unless you managed to get a table at the start. Staff seemed friendly and check in/out was quick and smooth. Wouldn't want to stay here for a long time, but for one night it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: CaptainRhythm
Reviews.Content: This hotels ticks all the boxes for me and is my "go-to" hotel whenever I stay in London. The hotel is located about two minutes walk from Earl's Court Tube, located in Zone 1, putting you close to all of the central London attractions. There's an excellent range of places to eat and drink on a budget around the hotel for those on a budget, giving a wide selection to suit all tastes. Every room I've stayed in has been of a great size and has always been clean. The beds are always comfortable and I've never been disrupted by any noise at nights. I'd recommend this hotel for those after a quality, safe hotel in central London without paying through the nose for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very average. Can do much better elsewhere for less!”
Reviews.Author: Matt_1990
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Dec '11 for 2 nights. We'd previously stayed at a similar priced hotel in Kensington, but were disappointed with this hotel's effort. The room we had (Ground floor, triple) was ridiculously small! There were three single beds, crammed into a very long, thin room. The bathroom was average, nothing to write home about. There was, however, less than appealing hairs all over the shower! Gross. Breakfast is a no-go. You can choose from boiled eggs or toast. That's really it. The walls are PAPER thin. We could here constant banging all morning with doors being slammed. It's in a good location, about a 2 minute walk form Earls Court tube station. Overall, you can do much better at other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Standard is suppose”
Reviews.Author: kellyonthebeach
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean as were the areas of the hotel we saw. We had a quad room and as a base for travelling around London it's ideal in terms of location and reasonable on price. Breakfast was a nightmare, not enough seats for a place that size so we ended up taking some more milk to our room and having a drink there before going tithe blackbird for a full English!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Enrico P
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in perfect area for us - walked to Holland & Hyde Park and museums. The concierge suggested lovely restaurants and a sightseeing tour to Bath and Stonehenge. The room was not huge but had a nice view of the garden.We're surprised to see squirrels and birds in the garden at this time.The price was right. This was our first trip to London and we will definitely come back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel...”
Reviews.Author: fab10lau
Reviews.Content: I walked in there on a tuesday evening of november and i might have taken their worst room available, which was the last room available by the way. I had no reservation therefore i cannot complaint about it since i've seen the room before to buy it. The room number was lg10, located outside the main building (just a couple of meters), under the groud; well equipped but also very small. What i haven't noticed at a first sight was a family of great spiders just at the entrance corner, which made me wonder about the cleanliness of that room....i am not sure about what would happen if in my place there would be a single woman..!!! As previously stated, the room was quite well equipped: electronic safe, telephone, a fridge (empty), hair dryer, tea making facility and complimentary tea, heating, flat screen television, shower and bath kit, an independent bathroom that was by the way very small and ugly (see picture). The common spaces are very few: a lobby in front of reception which was very very small, and the breakfast room where you can take breakfast from 7.30 to 9.30 which could definitely be improved. The hotel also offers wi-fi internet, for an extra charge â€“ i haven't tried this. The location is simply great, you will be on the earl court, where there are a lot of restaurants and all the services you might need, in few walks. The metro station â€œEarl's Courtâ€� is just few meters far, where you can reach picadilly and many other destinations in few stops. The staff was ok, even if I didn't have the chance to interact with them a lot. In sum the hotel is very good for the location and for the room services (as long as you take the rooms of the main building, not the one i took!!), breakfast and cleanliness could be improved, by the way this is not a top class hotel and the price is adeguate. Value for money is ok, if you consider to be in london earl's court, it wouldn't be the same at all if on another city or location.

Reviews.Title: “It's cheap and it shows”
Reviews.Author: Viktor01
Reviews.Content: Picking a hotel in London is always tricky. Personally i don't like to pay too much for the room, cause i'm never there. This hotel was really cheap. I wasn't expecting much. The room was REALLY small, and it wasn't the cleanest I've stayed in. The breakfast consisted of toast and coffee, but for that price we didn't expect more,problem was that it was really crowded. The last day we got our breakfast someplace else. The best thing about this Hotel, what you really pay for, is the location. It's like 1 minute from the tube!

Reviews.Title: “waste of money”
Reviews.Author: Ruth C
Reviews.Content: On the dirty side. Staff do not smile. Rooms are so small that you can not open your luggage. Only the location and breakfast are good.

Reviews.Title: “Never again- dusty & damp shoe box”
Reviews.Author: alienfrom
Reviews.Content: Nothing about my stay in this hotel over two nights made me think it was really worth Â£160 for a twin room (more like a shoebox). At the time of the booking there were few reviews, most of which were alright. I was not expecting much when I arrived but it even disappointed what little expectations I held. The twin room was tiny and smelt of damp and dust - the hotel staff had turned on the wall fan before we checked in to try and air out the room and cover the smell but needless to say that didn't work. The shelves in the bedroom hadn't been dusted for what looked like ten years, with the carpet smelling dusty and unclean. The bed felt unclean and I ended up kicking off the cover completley as it smelt like it hadn't been washed in quite a while. The pink bathroom from 1978 needs to be ripped out. No ventilation and the shower water alternated between boiling hot and freezing cold constantly. The towel supplied had stains and hairs stuck in it. Every wall had cracks, chips and marks all over them and one out of three lights in the room were working. Continental breakfast was bread you toasted yourself, a basket of hard boiled eggs and corn flakes with UHT milk. Far better off walking to Greggs down the street. The only positive would be the very short stroll to Earl's court tube station for ease of access throughout London. The state of the room meant that we tried to spend as little time possible in the dusty, damp room and saw quite a bit of London! I would never stay again and would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible but Cheap”
Reviews.Author: BenLooijenga
Reviews.Content: As part of tightening the purse strings in the office we have been looking at cheaper hotels in London when travelling on business. I paid Â£79 for one night stay for one person in this hotel. I wish I had paid more and gotten a better hotel... I Arrived at the hotel at about 5pm, it was super easy to find. A matter of 30 seconds to a minute walk maximum as you exit Earl's Court Underground, a real plus! The reception was nicely decorated and clean, there was a long queue and I was served about 15 minutes after arrival, a combination of a lack of staff and non-stop telephone calls being dealt with by only one member of staff. I was directed to my bedroom which was in the basement. The carpet going downstairs was worn to the floor and the walls were in desperate need of decoration. The bedroom was horrible and here are the reasons why: 3 single narrow beds, 1 had dirty bedding, no quilts, just bobbly blankets, dirty walls, light switches that didn't work, stained carpets, tiny bathroom, shower not big enough to move at all, moldy shower curtain, rusty shower rail (very), window that didn't lock and kept falling down, conservatory plastic corrugated roof (in the bedroom) which meant I didn't sleep because of the rain, lights that didnâ€™t work (bulbs gone), bedroom door that had an inch gap meaning lots of light in the room, cold draft (presumably from the roof) thin walls. On top of this I had very noisy teenage Spanish neighbours who were partying for most of the night. I don't begrudge them this but presume because of the price, this was the clientele the hotel attracted. Wifi was charged per hour, breakfat was included which I didnâ€™t want to stay for. I will be sure I never stay in this hotel again. Very disappointing, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly”
Reviews.Author: Marco D
Reviews.Content: great stay, spacious room, clean, staff were very helpful. breakfast was just what i needed, good coffee, cereal, boiled eggs and cheese a.nd breads. location was also good, transport easy and i recomend. mostly important i thought that the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “close to tube”
Reviews.Author: Shaaron1012
Reviews.Content: On June 8/th my granddaughter and I spent a night in London before going on to South Africa. We were looking for an inexpensive hotel near the tube---and this is it. Hotel is located within a block of the tube station, on a quiet street. The room was very adequate, and clean. It suited our needs to a tee. If you are not looking for fancy, but just a place to spend the night, (breakfast included) at a very reasonable rate, do consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location fantastic - everything else the worse you can find"”
Reviews.Author: vivekbhargava
Reviews.Content: the rooms are Tiny - and the mattress cover was just so dirty, preferred throwing it on the floor. the water is the shower was just trying to trickle down - complained to the reception, they said it is happening in the vicinity, they have called maintenance the basin is so small that one would require skill to wash their face without spilling water on the floor the hand shower holding pin was broken, so you can't fix the hand shower other than holding it with one hand TV did not work, had to complain, the person seems to be on the way wifi was 12 GBP for 10 hours, they said you can log in and out, but the screen vanished after logging in, so can't log out the breakfast place was crammed, i asked the server where can I find a plate, she rudely replied "do you have a table, if not, what are you going to do with the plate" some hotels give you plates at the table, others at the buffet, there was no reason to admonish me as I did not know the rules of this particular hotel I tried checking out, but came to know that my booking is non-refundable ! earlier I used to tell my assistant, just choose a good central london location walking distance from the Tube, however now one must reviews before booking a place

Reviews.Title: “Whats all the fuss about?”
Reviews.Author: garethelen
Reviews.Content: It really makes me wild to read some of the reviews about this hotel, Yes the rooms are not huge but at least they are clean, The staff that we encountered during our weekend were helpful and went out of their way to help us with threatre tickets, taxi's and recommending good restaurants in the area. The breakfast although we would of loved a full cooked breakfast it was fresh and plentiful. We first found the hotel on a booking agency web site but decided to telephone the hotel ourselves and book direct. We would deffo return the next time we are in "the Smoke" and my advise to any one would be don't believe everything you read, judge it yourself

Reviews.Title: “VERY BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: Borocouple
Reviews.Content: This may be a long rant, but is necessary to know the facts about the oxford hotel. During our stay we changed rooms 4 times. The first room was like all the rooms in the hotel - tiny and cramped not much space to move around. The carpet was DIRTY, I could not believe it, clumps of hairs, dust and food on the floor, it had not been hoovered. Then I checked the bedsheets and they had stains, but worst of all was the duvet had not been washed and was covered in crusty food the size of your hand matted into the duvet - disgusting. We went to reception and they agreed the room was in no condition so gave us a key to view another. Again the carpet had not been hoovered and was dirty. In the end we stayed in the 3rd room which wasnt as bad as others but floor still had not been hoovered. The next day they moved us into our 4th room which had a hard floor so nothing matted in carpet. This time clean bedsheets and bathroom, floor looked clean. However when I wiped floor with tissue it came up black and dusty and clumps of hair around the floor. So after been told we could not get a refund due to internet booking I cleaned the room myself, the floor and the dusty shelf and cabinet. We stayed 4 nights and each night we came back to the hotel the floor had not been cleaned, just bed made and I think the bathroom cleaned. Also something we eventually found funny, on the ground floor outside the lift door from the friday till we left on tuesday was a bloody plaster, which was visible and not one staff member had picked it up. The breakfast is not continental - just hard boiled eggs, bread for you to toast yourself and cornflakes - not a lot of choice! The location of the hotel is good less than 5min walk to earls court and that is all I can say that is good about this hotel - be warned. I strongly advise anyone who enjoys cleaniness does not stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “staff ok hotel terrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrEaton
Reviews.Content: we rocked up to the hotel at around 11pm very tired and very hungry eager to book in after we got redirected by the london underground, we were excited and had booked this hotel 6 months ago, i think more than 6 but at least 6 months, well we booked a triple room 3 of us 3 beds wanted, easy? youd think that wouldnt you?!! we were given our keys, hotel receptionist was abrupt but not horrible, given a remote control, to which we had to pay a holding fee of Â£50 for!!! steep but i understand why they do it but its not explained very well! so we toddled off to our room....wallop!!!!!....a room the size of a shoebox with one bed! supposed to be a twin bed but wasnt big! whatever noroom for 3 people! we went down stairs...sorry gentlemen theres been a mix up! so we went on the ground floor, a camp bed was put for one of us! the noise was terrible as we were on the street and right by the lift! no room literally for a poo excuse my bluntness in the lavatory! we were promised a room swap next night!!! so we woke in morning and to be fair we were told we would be moved! ok...now...breakfast....described as "world class" well um world a** is how i would descrbe it! bread was piled stale on a counter, boiled eggs were cold in a basket and thick as syryp orange juice! and an idiot trying to get toast out of an electric toaster with a metal fork!!!! quite simply s**t! sorry for my expletive but its the most apt description of my stay and its services for he money i paid which was a lot for this cess pit! we were moved in all fairness but we were told not to complain to them but to the operatives we booked through!!! and the beds were awful again! we only stayed 2 nights i would hate to stay there longer!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rvk66
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 23-25 July with my ten year old son. The entrance/lobby is inviting but the room (we shared a double) was very small, as was the en suite (shower, no bath). There was room for a double bed but access to it only down one side of the room. No cupboard space, but there was a tv and a kettle. The room could have done with redecoration and our view was at a brick wall at the back (we had room 212). On the PLUS side the bed was comfy, sheets clean and the water hot! Breakfast was cornflakes, toast/rolls, apple juice/tea/coffee, slices of cheese and hard boiled eggs, so ok but not enough choice and not really 'continental'. Hotel is 1 mins from Earls Court station (exit the station, turn right, go past Burger King and turn right again) - excellent location for accessing the rest of London. Would use again for the location but will probably pay more next time and opt for a 4 star, oh well, you pay your money, you make your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneDrljaca
Reviews.Content: Went from a horrible stay in Paris expecting not great service but was very shocked. Reception was extremely helpful when asking any kind of question. Not best location but 15 min bus pretty much outside the door to buckingham palace. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...”
Reviews.Author: Amywsp
Reviews.Content: First off, our room was TINY. I know European rooms are small, but this is the smallest I have ever seen. It was clean and quiet, though. The shower was also TINY. I have no idea how my husband moved in there because I struggled. The front desk staff are not very friendly; not rude, just not friendly. All in all, it was what we needed: a clean place to sleep. Also, the location is great because it is a few steps to Earl's Court station. I was really nervous after reading the other reviews, but it really was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff and great hotel location”
Reviews.Author: Lorrietravelbug
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 and I stayed for two nights in early July. We had just come from Athens Greece during the riots and was very happy to be in London. The hotel was comfortable and fit our needs. We had a room with four twin beds so it was tight in the room but it worked since we didn't stay in the room much. It was clean. The bathroom was also clean and the water pressure was fine. It didn't have any space in the bathroom for supplies but there was an area outside for storage and there was luggage storage space under the beds. The hotel does not have AC but we opened the window. It was cool enough. The best part was the friendly staff! They were very,very helpful in all our questions. The breakfast room was actually two rooms and they were always very busy. The breakfast staff worked hard to keep up with all the guests. I am a travel agent in Hawaii and I will recommended this hotel to clients.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely horrible”
Reviews.Author: kshkarina
Reviews.Content: It's like a nightmare staying here for three nights. There are ants crawling on the wall, and there is no space for us to put our luggage. The toilet is super horrifying! But the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Dire”
Reviews.Author: halesy26
Reviews.Content: Spent the night in a Â£75 per night room, absolutely horrible. So small, the double bed was pressed against the wall in the corner with no room around it. Bedlinen was dated and contained hairs from a previous occupant. Extension leads dangling next to the bed and a beautiful brickwall view but had to miss out on it (shame) as had to keep the curtains shut due to the room opposite being able to look directly in. Room got far too hot for a mild June evening and the fan just didn't cut it. Bathroom was fairly clean but shower was tiny and had to manouevre round the sink to use the toilet. Shaving light didn't work. The only saving grace of this place was the staff who were polite but I would never ever stay again. By far the worst hotel room I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Serious security issues!”
Reviews.Author: kkt8
Reviews.Content: The hotel room in itself was fine considering the price; the only negative thing was a faint smell of the sewer from time to time (room was below street level, but with a window). The issue that made us very worried for safety was that we discovered, accidentally, that our key opened everyone else's doors! We asked the staff about this right after we opened the door to the wrong room by accident, thinking first that the room just wasn't cleaned yet. Their response was that this is a malfunctioning and they will call technical help to come and fix it. They didn't ask us to return the key or anything. For the night, we used the luggage to jam the door. The next morning, after checking out, the same person told us that we were simply given the wrong key by accident. Whichever is the truth, I would not sleep here again. They also ask for a 40-50 pound deposit for the key and remote control. If you don't have cash, they offer you the possibility of swiping your credit card and giving the pin number, in case they later have to charge for a missing key or remote. To me, this sounds very shady as well; might of course be innocent.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CameronHL
Reviews.Content: This is the Oxford Hotel Penywern Road Earls Court I stayed at this hotel on my own to go to the Chelsea Flower Show. I booked on Airmiles. Overall I think the hotel is good value for money. It is very close to Earls Court station but is still quiet and peaceful. The room was small but clean and had a TV, wet room ,safe, hairdryer and kettle. It took me some time to realise that I had to plug the kettle in with an extension cable under the bed. The public areas are very nice. The staff are very helpful. Only negative comment is that breakfast is a little limited. A choice of cereal and orange juice instead of apple would be good. I would definitely use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Missed to speak to my relative after 15 yrs ...all because of the operator”
Reviews.Author: kigaLondon
Reviews.Content: On the 26th May 2011 around 7pm i called the switch board to speak to my long lost sister after 15 yrs , To my surprise , the operator refused to connect me for some reason. When ever i called , he hanged up on me more than 5 times i tried , The way he answered the phone was so aggresive as " HELLO " no hotel manners i`m used to in other hotels round the world. I work for the Raddissson Hotels in London . iT TOOK ME BY SURPRISE THAT SOME HOTELS DONT CARE ABOUT THEIR GUESTS. In that case , i will always keep that picture in my mind and surely will inform my friends and family to avoid it. Im really sooo sad that a mere switch board operator did determine my communication with my lost family after 15 yrs. That was my only way of communication , since they did have other means.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish!”
Reviews.Author: carole1947
Reviews.Content: I have seen larger closets than the supposed "double" I stayed in. The room was miniscule and I couldn't get into the shower room if my husband was standing next to the bed. Double bed was actually 2 singles which weren't even level. The shower only had a tiny drain in the floor which meant a lot of the water was splashing onto the floor and being trailed into the bedroom from under the shower curtain. The towels in the shower room were so hard and scratchy that they actually hurt my skin. I didn't find the receptionist very helpful either and would certainly never return there again. My own fault I suppose, as I decided to choose somewhere cheaper than I normally would, as they were on the line to Heathrow. My advice is best to stay clear!

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic...what you see on the website is not what you get!”
Reviews.Author: DubaiCamel2176
Reviews.Content: Absolutely disgusting...booked a family room for 6 nights but checked out after only one. This so-called family room could barely fit the 4 beds, let alone accommodate the 4 people....no table, no chair/s.....and no space for luggage; we were unable to walk around the beds * Carpet was filthy * No shower recess; had to shower on toilet/bathroom floor (shower curtain, which did nothing to stop water pouring all over the floor was held up by home made curtain rod) * No air-conditioning (no air flow through room....room was stuffy) * Window of this ground floor room could not be locked and lead directly onto an overgrown junk storage area * The safe was not secured; could be picked up and carried out of the room * No mini-bar * The so-called manager was rude and claimed he was too busy to assist

Reviews.Title: “What was that SMELL?!”
Reviews.Author: LassieFeEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: It really worries me that there are 476 less popular hotels than this - that surely sounds a death knell for quality, value accommodation in this city as this is the worst place I have ever stayed. To save me getting into an unhelpful, emotional, and biased rant after two awful nights at this establishment, I'll just lay out the facts for you: â€¢ Upon arrival I was checked into a room on the lower ground floor. I got out of the lift and was greeted by a repugnant smell that can only be described as wet carpet, that had been washed with a dirty cloth, and left to dry slowly. Fine I thought, Iâ€™ll just get into my room and shut it out. No such luck â€“ my room smelled exactly the same. Give it a chance I thought â€“ Iâ€™ll open the window and let it air out. 2 hours later though the smell was as bad as ever, so I went up to ask reception to move me. Instead they sent down two extraordinarily unhelpful members of staff, who pretended not to smell anything, then proceeded to spray the whole floor with heavily scented air freshener as soon as I closed my door. â€¢ My door, ah yes â€“ my door which didnâ€™t lock. I asked the unhelpful maintenance man to please fix my lock â€“ to which he replied â€œno, thereâ€™s no need, only you have a key.â€� Yes, I said, but they are keycards, and staff can programme them to access any room they like. â€œNo, only you have a keyâ€�. I could see I was not getting anywhere with the man, so instead I had to barricade myself in my room using the spare bed and a makeshift door-wedge. Not the safe, comfortable environment a woman travelling on her own wants to experience. â€¢ The shower, apart from being covered in mould around the bottom seals, was so small that I had to stand with my tummy against the wall to stop the freezing cold curtain sticking to my back â€“ Iâ€™m a size 8, so god knows how anyone of any size or stature is meant to fit in there. â€¢ The hairdryer broke within 10 seconds of using it. â€¢ None of the plugs fit â€“ to boil the kettle I had to sit under the table pushing the plug in. Not exactly safe. â€¢ The safe doesnâ€™t work either, despite following both sets of directions. â€¢ Breakfast, as one of my fellow reviewers noted, consisted of stale bread to toast, and even staler own-brand cornflakes. â€¢ And to round off my stay nicely, I woke up this morning to find a tick feasting on my leg. Iâ€™ve kept it and will be posting it to the management. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy - avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for a quick city break”
Reviews.Author: VeeVee_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the Royal Wedding. Pluses: close to Tube stop, friendly staff, good sized double room Minuses: groundfloor room got dreadfully hot. Only ventilation a small fan or keeping the window open (I didn't feel comfortable doing that on the groundfloor). Carpet could use a good cleaning. Don't forget to bring your own toiletries. (Surprisingly the room had a hairdryer though) All in all not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Hotel Earl's Court”
Reviews.Author: Elefant350
Reviews.Content: Paid Â£35 for a room, I think it was Â£40 for a twin but as a one night stay Hotel in the Earl's Court area this was perfect. Very small room and limited facilities but for a place to sleep after a day at the exhibition or after a show this was ideal. The place was clean and on a relatively quiet road. Rooms are up to date with flat screens and new bathrooms. Wouldn't recommend spending a week here and don't expect a view from the window. Within a couple of minutes walk from Earl's Court exhibition centre and the tube line. Breakfast was continental but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “VERY, VERY SMALL ROOMS WITH VIEW ONTO A BRICK WALL AND RUBBISH TIP.”
Reviews.Author: pat187049
Reviews.Content: BEWARE THE ROOM YOU GET. My husband and I booked this hotel for a night and thank goodness it was only one night! Although the hotel is in a reasonable position the main problem is the rooms. We booked a double, which turned out to be 9' by 7' and so cramped we couldn't stand up together in the available space! The bed was pushed against one wall with a 12" wide table on the other side (no room for anything else!). No storage space, fridge didn't work and 2" gap under door to corridor. Despite the website saying the rooms overlook the garden or tree lined street, many of them look onto the walls of the buildings next door and the accumulated rubbish (old cups, paper bottles etc) in the adjoining space. Horrible! The staff offered to move us to an empty triple if we paid Â£40 more. Breakfast was OK - cereals, bread and cheese - but the dining area is so small it was truly uncomfortable (and hot) to eat there. Tables are jammed in and some butted up against others so you could only get in and out by asking others to move. Not ideal when they're in the middle of their breakfast. Would not use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, low quality, noisy”
Reviews.Author: kitingchristy
Reviews.Content: Pros: close to Earl's Court if you attend to a trade show, it's 5mins walk, brilliant Cons: where to start? Bedrooms at ground level are so noisy i could not sleep the 1st night.. Bedrooms on 3rd floor are tiny & the bathroom is the most unusual: the shower head is over the seat of the toilet, so one showers over the toilet. Demp is quite bad. Staff must be paid peanuts as no one smiled at breakfast (mega noisy room where you nearly fight to make a piece of toast), breakfast is dear for what it is, etc The overall experience (2nights) was awful, i do not recommend for 90GBP a night, one can find better, so much better!

Reviews.Title: “Fair price, very convenient location and friendly faces”
Reviews.Author: Plato1London
Reviews.Content: We didn't have high expectations as we only needed a base to stay for the weekend. Early check in was a bonus at no extra cost, then found excellent recommendations in the guest information folder and decided to explore the area. The Pembroke was an amazing find as well as the Troubadour and Leighton House. Our football tickets were posted to the hotel and were given to us on arrival by the very friendly Flavio. The breakfast was simple but suited our needs. The room was clean and comfortable. I will definetely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming staff and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: LVINOGRADOV
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful, location is perfect for my purposes, good transport rate was the best I could find, so wan't expecting very much, but was pleasantly surprised. Concierge recommended I visit Lord Leighton House and Holland Park, which were such amazing finds and also his recommendation for food/wine tasting at the organic superstore. The rooms in the hotel were average size, clean and airy. I will definetely return!

Reviews.Title: “Warning Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: tassiedevil93
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here in August 2010 for what become the worst 5 days in a hotel room imaginable. Having travelled for 4 months around Europe & the UK, we looked forward to getting to London for some "Pub Food" and "Great Beer". We certainly got this but we also got the worst hotel in London. After arriving around 4pm (From France) we were told our room was not ready for another hour. No problem, off to the pub. When we returned the hotel the manager who was on duty, informed us our room was "A little on the small side compared to those in Australia", we acknowledged his honesty and proceeded down the road to our room (Our room was in another building 3 doors down the road). When we entered the room we were speechless (I can't write what I said, may be offensive) the room had a double bed and a shelf with a safe (not screwed down, more on that later) and thats it. Yes, there was a bathroom, and I kid you not, we thought of sleeping in there as it was larger than the bedroom. We could not put our cases on the floor to open them up as there was not enough floor space. I went to the reception and advised our disappointment and was meet with a "This is London, Not Sydney" responce. We had no option as we had prepaid the room. After we got settled (approx. 1 minute, as there is not much to do in a shoe box) we put our passports etc in the safe. This seemed to work well, but when I checked to ensure it was locked I nearly pulled it off the shelf. Upon closer inspection I noticed it was not secured down, there were scews there but had come loose. I again went to reception to obtain a screwdriver as I am quite capable of fixing this & I knew it would take forever for them to do it. "I'm sorry, we don't have a scewdriver available, I'll get someone to fix it, tommorrow" The next day we went sight seeing (The hotel location is perfect, right next to Earl's court station) after returning, we found our ground floor window was wide open and allowed very easy access for any would-be-thief to get in and steal our property, including our safe, which of course, was not fixed and luckily we never left anything in there. After this incident I went across the road to the Best Western hotel to obtain a room as it looked pretty good from the outside. I asked to see the room which was perfect, but they had no vacancies for our stay (I told them I was coming back in a couple of weeks, soory I lied, I just wanted to see the room), very well appointed, clean, fresh and only about 20 pounds a night dearer. I could go on & on about how incompetent and unhelpful the Oxford hotel is, but I think you get the message. Please, check in to the Best Western across the road (Can't remember the name, but easy to find) and you will enjoy your stay a lot more. Oh, the breakfast consist of toast (stale) & cereal (in an open container and no scoop) steer clear of this and go onto Earls court road, a very nice bakery there.

Reviews.Title: “TINY ROOM, EVEN MORE TINY BATHROOM”
Reviews.Author: Rastaman79
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, just around the corner from Earls court tube station. Front desk guys were always helpful and kind. We were given a tiny room in the first floor, facing the front street. Our room was clean and warm, but really tiny. HotelÂ´s staff made a great job in forcing two single beds into such a small place (of course beds were narrow and uncortable for a coulple. They were put together, but they moved apart constantly). there was also a ridiculously small space that worked as a desk, but forget about it if you are a big guy. The space for entering the desk area is not more than 20 cm width. There is not space for placing the luggage, so you have to block the aisle in front of the main door. Cleaning ladies come to your room once a day only, if you are still in the room, they will just left some clean towells in front of your room and will not come back to clean the room. the bathroom was clean, but even more tiny than the room. The sink was so small that it is impossible to wash your mouth or your face without pooring water on the floor, and since no floor toilets are provided, yo will probably end making a mess. Shower is really small as well, I donÂ´t think a big guy will be able to take a shower in such a small space. Rooms facing the front street can be really noisy at nights, since there are some pubs near the hotel and it is uncommon to hear drunk guys shouting and even figthing near the hotel. Breakfast has poor variety (only coffee, tea, orange juice, bread, chese, and mermelade are available. Fianally, internet is not free, and can be bought at a rate of 2 pounds per 2 hours. Just a tip, the internet time you buy is consumed only once you connect to the wireless system, so you can use the same code for several days. PROS: Great location. Friendly staff. Clean. Free coffee and tea in the room. CONS: Tiny room and bathroom. Poor breakfast variety. Paid internet. Ugly decoration.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: marioloizou
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming reception staff gave me very good recommendations and were always very polite. The room was very clean and the hotel an execellent base to explore London. My family had organised champagne through the hotel concierge as it was my birthday. The hotel added a little touch with some belgian chocolates. Old fashioned hospitality. Definetely recommend !

Reviews.Title: “A really pleasant stay with good comfort and wonderful service allround.”
Reviews.Author: Oldbelair
Reviews.Content: I found the Qxford Hotel to be a great hotel for many reasons : good location, good service, excellent value for money, and most accommodating to the traveller. The rooms are comfortable and the beds great. It was clean and very pleasant. Would have been nice to have even a larger room, but was still good value forf money. I will definately stay there again. The general manager at the hotel is excellent and sees to all the detail in a most professional manner Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LG12
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Oxford. After reading some of the reviews we must admit we were a bit dubious about staying here but we needn't have worried. We were situated on the 3rd floor. The corridors are quite narrow but I suppose this is due to the age of the building, Our room was a decent size. It was 2 two single beds put together to form a double, I must admit the first thing I did was check the bedding after some of the reports on here but it very clean and the mattress seemed fairly new. The only down size was that we only had one pillow each, The room was warm at times but there was a fan directed towards to the bed which was quite powerful. The bathroom was rather strange as it was a wet room with the shower directly over the toilet! I had worries about flooding the room but all the water did seem to escape down the drain, thankfully! Overall the room was small but clean and to be honest we hardly spent any time there as we were enjoying the sights in London, The breakfast is ok if you like toast but it was adequate. There was also tea, coffee and orange juice available and for Â£65 a night with breakfast it is great value. The location is fantastic. Literally a 30 second walk from Earls Court tube station and this line will take you straight to central London, There are numerous bars and restaurants located in the vicinity. My recommdations for things to do include Harrods and Regent Street, the Tower of London (definitely worth the Â£17 admission fee) and seeing London at night. Overall, We enjoyed our stay and would probably return to the Oxford in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What everyone says on here is a load of rubbish!”
Reviews.Author: mj476
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of visiting shows in London and I head down there a lot. I have stayed in a lot of budget hotels and I can honestly say that the Oxford Hotel is fantastic, I have not one complaint. To be honest after paying Â£60 for a centre hotel close to a tube station, I was expecting the worse! I was greeted by a lovely reception who joked about booking the wrong room and my friend having to sleep in the shower - It gave us a giggle. We were given the basement room. Thinking of a dark, smelly cramped room, we walked into a renovated nicely sized room with a huge window looking up into the street, the light was lovely. The bathroom was fine and the room was very clean. There were no bed bugs, no marks on the sheets or carpets, or hair in the shower. Its pathetic! It wasn't like the Ritz, we were paying Â£60 and when your paying Â£60 you expect a Â£60 room. This room was worth more than Â£60. The area is safe too, the tube is round the corner, there are two nice pubs and a M&S food shop, the hotel also has a list of recommended restaurants. I had a great time in London and the Oxford Hotel is the first hotel I have been to which i will use again and again. Please ignore the reviews people have left. There expecting far too much for there money in London and I would love to book them into some of the crap holes I've visited in my time, and then ask them what they think of the Oxford.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS, BLOOD & OTHER BODILY FLUIDS UUGGGHHH”
Reviews.Author: travellingwilberry49
Reviews.Content: Need I say more. Don't stay here - you would be safer and more comfortable sleeping on a park bench!. This hotel is advertised as "an attractive & well appointed hotel, newly refurbished to a very high standard and situated in the heart of the West End" The only true thing is about the location. I arrived about 9.30 pm on a Wednesday night after a full day of travel from Europe. I was returning to Australia the next day so just wanted a room in an area of London I was familiar with - having earlier in my trip stayed with friends at Kensington. I was given room G5 which was just to the right of reception. The layout of the rooms in this area is difficult to negotiate - holding doors open while trying to squeeze yourself and luggage in as well as open the door to your room. Room had three single beds and bathroom. The window opened on to another area of the hotel so it could not be opened. Air Conditioning didn't work either. The carpet was very old as it was hard, stained and tacky. In the morning I discovered live bed bugs and captured one under a glass, while I went out to see management. I was told by male receptionist he could not do anything as he was not the manager and the manager would be in at 11.00 am. he sent two cleaners around Adel (male) and Laura to confirm that bed bugs were present. I asked them not to touch the bug as I wanted to show the hotel management - however Adel promptly squshed the bug so it was barely recognisable. At this time a smelled a rat. The manager Marco - apparently arrived earlier than 11 but did not bother to come and see me when he arrived, but I approached reception again closer to check out time. Marco insisted that all the mattresses were special type which would kill any bed bugs and he also insisted the room had only been refurbished 1.5 years ago. I challenged him on this pointing out the condition of the carpet and also the mattress where the button like things are were frayed etc. On inspecting the mattress there were no markings on mattress to indicate it had any microbiological properties but only then discovered blood and other bodily fluid stains to which I gasped with a horrified look saying this is disgusting. Marco also had a bit of a shocked look on his face but was not moving from his position that the room was clean & newly refurbished. but then to my shock and horror accused me of bringing the bed bugs in because Australian hotels are rampant with them. He then also accused me of simply wanting a free night in London. I asked him several times if he would be happy paying 75 pound to sleep with bed bugs to which I got no response except further accusations. Marco said before anything was done he would contact the mattress company and have them investigate. I said that won't do me any good as I was returning home (to my own home own bed that does't have bed bugs!) . Marco also said that he has been with the hotel for 23 years and he has never had a report of bed bugs. However that is a lie as a review on this website also has a customer who discovered bed bugs. Customer service is non-existent and intimidation tactics are high. I say this because two large male staff and a female staff member and then little old me were in the room discussing this issue - I did get anywhere - not even a partial refund but the real point is management accepted absolutely no responsibility just blamed the consumer - the people that are keeping food on their tables. Don't stay here - even if there is no-where to stay if you are visiting London for the olympics. they may be able to change mattresses, carpets etc but you can't change attitudes and values that quickly!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location... non-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: stinnastinna
Reviews.Content: I stayed there from oct 13 to oct 17 (2010) with my friend. We got to the hotel and went to check in, we got kind of surpised because we had to give creditcard information if Ã¤nyhting went missing in the room. We had paid the room in advance and had not heard about this. The gentleman in the reception told us basically it was if the remotecontrol to the televison disappeard! We ended up giving 50 pounds as collatoral. Our room was small but had the basics u need. But the bathroomfloor was dirty. It didn't look clean at all. Unfortunately. On day 3 of our visit the maid hadn't left any toiletpaper in the room, so it was heard to go to the bathroom. I phoned the reception and the man that picked up the phone told he was all alone but would come up shortly with some paper - which he in the end also did. Thought it was in overall a medium experience we had at this hotel. But our trip as a whole was good. But the breakfast was very poor.. Just toast, toast and more toast.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Anthiaa
Reviews.Content: I could stand in the middle of the room, stretch out my arms and touch both walls - ROOM WAS TINY! But it wasn't bad at all. The location was the best thing about this hotel After a long day sightseeing we'd get off the tube and be in the hotel room within a minute. Earls Court has everyhting you would need, including M&S food and an internet cafe across the street. Staff were really helpful. That makes a big difference. It was clean. There was an awful plastic mattress protector that boiled me in my sleep but I just took it off. The room only had a fan. Had to leave window open overnight but the street was REALLY noisy. I woke up nearly every night despite being tired from long days of sightseeing. Breakfast layout and food was not great. Toaster not working properly, awkward set out, very plain and poor quality choice of breakfast food. We ended up buying muesli and eating in the room. Tiny, but quite acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Small but good enough. Good location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: mint09
Reviews.Content: Booked a triple room. Must admit that the room was really small that 3 of us had to squeeze past one another. Breakfast was okay if you don't mind eating the same food everyday. Overall, it was acceptable for a budget hotel. Rooms are clean and comfortable, staffs at the reception are really helpful and friendly. Great location btw, a mere 5 mins walk to the Underground. May consider coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Small room even for London”
Reviews.Author: bradmase
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on our trip and the room on the first stay was the smallest room I have ever seen in a hotel. Whilst you have to expect this sort of thing in London this one was tiny!!! The worst thing though was the heat inside the rooms which was easily 10 degrees warmer than outside making things extremely uncomfortable. The second stay was better with a larger cooler room so that made up for the first stay. Location wise this is a great place with an easy tube ride into London and some good local restaurants. Value wise, well, theres not really such a thing with London hotels.

Reviews.Title: “avoid!”
Reviews.Author: horozoglu
Reviews.Content: My travel agency made a mistake and reserved a triple room for me, my wife and our 10 yr old twins. Be careful; Triple room in their world means three separate single beds! Although they did not provide a room which is big enough to accommodate us they charged extra 10 pounds/night for a 10 yr old child. They even charged 5 pounds for leaving our luggage for 2 hours after checkout. The hotel management is very opportunist and unfriendly. You can find much friendlier hotels in the same area and elsewhere within similar price range.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Disaster”
Reviews.Author: edely88
Reviews.Content: On our arrival, we checked in and the receptionist gave us our keys for our two rooms. When we went to one of the rooms, we opened the door to find that there were people in that room in bed. the receptionist said " oh they must have gone into that room insead of room ***," so he put us in that room. When I was going for a shower i pulled back the shower door, but the handle came off, along with 3 of the hinge's that kept the door hanging. The Staff in the breakfast area were very rude and ignorant. When a family member asked for a clean glass, they said, " go into the kitchen". And when i asked for a tissue/napkin to clean my hands they said oh we're so busy and we're finished. Overall i found this stay to be awful, the staff and receptionist were ignorant and very rude. And it was a health and safety issue with the shower door. I would totally avoid this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “book at your peril”
Reviews.Author: trevor74
Reviews.Content: not child friendly at all. there were no baby chairs, so our baby had to sit on my lap while my wife waited in line with about 20 0ther people for a few pieces of bread and a glass of long life milk for breakfast. breakfast was a real disappointment and a little stressful. staff not very helpful in the kitchen area, and when i got up to get a bowl of cereal i returned to find my table had been cleared and other people were about to take my seat. small and very claustrophobic. the rooms were very small and tightly packed together, not entirely noise proof either, as noisy neighbours were able to wake me up through talking in the room next to us. we also had to walk outside and go to another building to get to the reception and to have breakfast. the rooms were clean, but the the bathroom did not have a bath or any shampoo, etc. and the furniture seemed rather basic and some of the amenities didn't work such as the fridge which turned some milk into cheese after one day and the tea maker which couldn't be plugged in as the furniture had been build over the plug socket. the safe also did not work. location is excellent for exploring london, however, the staff at the reception had no notification of our request for a child's bed despite the manager assuring us prior to booking that it would be available. 3 out of 10 at best.

Reviews.Title: “Good location , but dont expect much else”
Reviews.Author: Ratra
Reviews.Content: Got down to London with friends and stayed at the Oxford hotel again.. it has a good location, reason why we stayed there but dont expect much from it,, and it seems it is getting worse. There used to be a nice guy there in the morning that helped you with info, tickets etc,,, Not any longer,,it is sorry, take a map and good luck... Well the map is still free and probably the only thing free you will get. Internet (wifi) is available at very hight prices,, ( Net cafe nearby much cheaper) Pay by Credit card,, extra 3% Hold luggage after check out,,,, it is Â£5 or more per room, and it does not matter if you are a returning customer... before they would keep it for free or Â£5 for everything. so 3 rooms,, Â£15 for a few hours luggage storage So all in all not a bad place as long as you dont expect anything more than a bed to sleep.. unfortunately it feels pretty much give me your money , take the key and nothing else. I would avoid: * basement rooms,, smell damp * top floor on the Annex building,,,,, no water in the morning for shower so if you can get a good deal and are easy to please, go for it otherwise,,, there are better places in the area still London is a great place

Reviews.Title: “Good if you don't mind staying in a rabbit hutch, with rabbit food.”
Reviews.Author: dogwatch21
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. The twin room was just over 6ft wide, by approx 13ft long, this includes the shower room!! ,No cupboards, drawers or shelves to put anything. The only hook was on the back of the shower room door. The shower room was so small that to use the very small sink ( with very large tap!! ) the door had to be open!?!. The only place to store anything is in the suitcase which, by lifting the bed, could be stored under the bed. Beds were only 2ft 6in wide. There is a so called wardrobe but this was only 18in wide, very high rail, and only 5 captive hangers. Underneath this is a safe ( did not work ) and a fridge. Room was extremely hot but fitted with large wall fan. Kettle shelf, again very small, on wall at foot of bed. Continental breakfast was white or brown bread. toaster, help yourself, water boiler foe tea or coffee,small dish of jams on formica tables and cheap chairs. A large bowl of cornflakes(?) and milk. None of the food was covered or wrapped. On the day we went down to breakfast 28/05/10. there was no ham, or cheese, or fruit. There were two jugs of juice. Not fruit juice, more like powdered juice mixed with water. Revolting! This is a HOSTEL not a hotel, and definitely not worth the Â£265 I paid for three nights. I told the manager so and we were moved to a triple room. We did not partake of any food at all. The triple room would have been the same area, pro rata, as the twin room. As I booked with an agent, I am now trying to get some money refunded. D Clark.

Reviews.Title: “not to be recommended”
Reviews.Author: metropolis4711
Reviews.Content: The rooms were partly in the lower ground floor with a view up to the pavement. To be out of view we had to close the curtains. The heating could not be turned off to cool the room we had to open the windows. The size of our parents' room was bedsize plus 50 cm on one side and at the end of the bed. The restaurant was in the lower ground floor. If you want to leave your luggage at the hotel before you leave it costs 5 pounds extra for every piece.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AVOID AVOID!!!”
Reviews.Author: pbwriter
Reviews.Content: This place was a cheap, badly run dump! Minuscule room, certainly not worth the prices they're asking. Not even a soap dish in the tiny shower - also no shampoo or washcloths. No working air conditioning anywhere. Coin-operated internet with only 2 chairs for 2 computers, so if a couple used one computer, there was no place to sit to use the other. (Apparently, there are no spare chairs in the entire hotel.) Need to put a key card in a wall socket to get electricity! Poor management, desk clerks with obnoxious attitudes, worst place to stay ever! AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS!! The website makes it look nice, but it is FREAKING AWFUL!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ungdomsskolen
Reviews.Content: It is the third stay in the Oxford Hotel for Assens Ungdomsskole. This time with 30 youngsters. The manager and staff are very friendly and helpfull. Some of the rooms are quite small, but all very clean and new refurbished. Situated in nice Chelsea very close to the Tube, Oxford Hotel is very much to recommend. We look forward to come back. K. Kristensen Headmaster Assens Ungdommsskole Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Good value (for London)”
Reviews.Author: floggit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel just for 1 night as part of a Show & Stay package with "Superbreak". The whole thing only cost Â£125.00 for the 2 of us, so we weren't expecting much anyway. The Hotel seemed to be run mostly by East Europeans or Middle East people who were extremely polite and helpful. The reception area is quite small, and we had to wait here (only for a short time though) whilst we were allocated a room, as the Hotel does not have a Residents Lounge.The room we were in was in the annexe next door and although quite small contained everything we needed for our stay. it was clean and modern with up-to-date, but basic furnishings. The shower room was, again, very small and this being the case, not enough thought had been put in at the design stage with regard to drainage, as the room soon got, unavoidably over-wet whenever we took a shower. That said, the level of cleanliness was excellent and very hard to criticise on any level, really. The package included 'continental breakfast' , and if you are expecting anything decent in this respect, then you will be really disappointed. All it was really, was make you own toast with cheapo white (only) bread, upon which you can spread some cheapo margarine and/or cheapo jam or marmalade. Help yourself to tea or coffee and/or horrible sickly sweet cheapo fruit juice. If you like a good breakfast and don't mind paying, their are plenty of cafes in the area, so I would suggest you just go straight out the door and skip the Hotel's Restaurant completely.So to summarise I would say that this is a very good Hotel if you are only staying for up to 3 nights (minus the breakfast!). Anything longer than that would be unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty - Smells and look for another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roy2302
Reviews.Content: The room was dirty, mould on the bathroom tiles. The carpet hasn't been clean etc.. If you are on a very low budget then it MIGHT be acceptable, but it's shocking!!!

Reviews.Title: “Coin operated internet and communal ironing room.”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTraveler999
Reviews.Content: This hotel was about 1 step above a hostel. Desk manager always seemed a bit frazzled, first hotel room smelled like someone had a 4 day smoking contest to hot box the room. If you wanted to use the internet you could either a) pay by the hour (no comment) or b) use the coin operated computers from 1999 in a room off from the main desk. Free breakfast in the morning consisted of about 70 people packed into 2 small breakfast nooks eating cereal and drinking OJ. The beds were twin with the night stand bolted down so you couldn't push them together. The only positive about this is the location to Earl's court and a tube station.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DISAPPOINTMENT!”
Reviews.Author: LRPIreland
Reviews.Content: The only positive about this hotel is its handy location. Despite reading warnings in other reviews about the basement rooms, we mistakenly went by its 3 star rating, and with a degree of hope that we would get a room upstairs. Unfortunately, it was a forlorn hope. We were given room LG3: tiny and sparse, like a converted corridor with passers-by able to peer down at will from the pavement above. No net curtains, bags of rubbish stored in alcove under pavement just outside our window, an area used by staff who, during our short stay, were able to easily look into our room if they so chose. Toilet seat unhinged on one side and of wrong size. Breakfast Room and other bedrooms crammed in far too close, so making it impossible to have a lie-in on the Saturday morning after both of us had returned late. Chambermaid opened door on same morning without knocking. Cleaning staff very noisy carrying out their duties. Couldn't work out if occupants of room next door were guests or staff, but were certainly noisy at 1am on Sunday (no effort to be quiet, talking and slamming room door). Plummbing very noisy, distubed for a could hour in early hours of Saturday by constant running water nearby."Clean" sheets and towels dumped by lift door, presumably ready for use. 9.30 for last serving of breakfast, especially at weekend, is unreasonable. Reception staff disinterested and cold. The basement feels like every opportunity to maximise profit has been made to the detriment of the comfort and enjoyment of the guests. We do not expect The Ritz for a weekend break but this hotel was well below par and we would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average for budget stay but many flaws”
Reviews.Author: potato86
Reviews.Content: This is very close to Earls Court tube station which was extremely handy. On arrival the place looked attractive, until we stood waiting for 10 minutes for the 'receptionist' to acknowledge our presence which he didn't until we spoke up. He did not greet us or smile and just lacked very basic customer service and manners. The hotel looked like it had just been refurbed so it was very clean. However, although not a big deal for us the room was very tiny and there was virtually not even enough room to put a suitcase! The bathroom was clean although VERY compact- could not even fill the kettle in the sink or wash my face. There was also quite a large gap beneath the bathroom door and the bedroom door! You could clearly hear toilets flushing from other rooms and doors banging as the walls were so hollow. I must add that we have stayed in cheaper and better hostels in London. All in all it was nothing unbearable however I don't think the price at all reflects what you receive.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service & breakfast - to be avoided”
Reviews.Author: Gino44
Reviews.Content: Firstr surprise: they ask 3% surcharge (receptionist was really unfriendly) to pay by credit card, even though they couldn't (at least for AMEX). The double room turned out to be a twin room (luckily it was then changed). Room was really tiny with window on earls court station (noisy),the sink in the bathroom was almost invisible and there was no european plug (offered at the reception for 5Â£) But the worse part was the breakfast: room fully packed, with a pile of toilet paper in a corner, poor food (only tea and awful instant coffee as hot drinks, no sausages, no cakes or other sweet stuff), queue to toast a bit of bread and at 9.30 sharp they cleaned the desk leaving us half a way through the breakfast. Not expensive but absolutely not worth the money they ask. To be avoided

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small hotel worth the money spent”
Reviews.Author: kelliottrocks Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Oxford Hotel. The rooms were small but a more than reasonable size for a double room. The en suite bathroom was very clean and well kept, in good condition. The shower was hot and easy to use, which is always handy! The hotel is literally a 2 minute walk fro Earls Court underground station which was perfect to easily get back to after a night out! The breakfast was very limited, literally cornflakes, milk, bread, toaster and plenty of jam, but that was perfect for us when we went. I will be returning to the Oxford Hotel for my trips in London, as it was so convenient for nightlife, theatres and was clean and nice. I did not find the hotel loud at all, and we very much enjoyed our time there. The staff were friendly, particularly the reception staff who were smiley and jokey and seemed pleased to see us when we returned to check-out.

Reviews.Title: “such an amazing location - great hotel - just go for it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Balidream
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, very easy to find and with all amenities a few steps away. The moment we went in and checked in, the level of customer service was higher that I expected, we felt they were pleased with our visit. Upon check out was great too. The receptionist went that extra mile finding something we were looking for (he didn't need to do this for us). The room was small, but we didn't need bigger than this. Was great for us, clean and warm (it was snowing outside the whole stay in London). It wasn't noisy when we stayed despite other reviews stating it was noisy. Also... no beesties at all. It was clean and nice. I recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in central London and is not too fussy about hotels in general. Enjoy! Carolyn

Reviews.Title: “Small but decent”
Reviews.Author: BKHKGal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located around the corner from the Earl's Court tube station. There's also a Mark's & Spencer Simply Food right down the block, and a cornish pasty joint plus a couple of other mini-markets nearby so you definitely can never starve. I stayed here with a friend and the room was extremely small. It consisted of 2 single beds, a nightstand and fridge. There wasn't even room to hang your clothes. The bathroom also had no space to store your toiletries. Breakfast was simple ... toast, cereal, cheese (if you're lucky), tea, coffee, and orange juice. They have internet access but save your money and go to the internet cafe across the street from the tube station. They only charge 1 pound for an hour. The guys at the front desk were extremely helpful. However the hotel has to work on their smoke alarm system because we were woken up 3 times during the 10 days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bastianmis
Reviews.Content: We had 4 nights in this hotel, and there was nothing bad to say, when you compare to the price paid. Small room, but ok. Breakfast is nothing special, but you can survive until lunch. Staff very helpful and polite, All in all, an ok stay. Very central, easy to the tube.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and value for money.”
Reviews.Author: thetravellingcouple
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Oxford Hotel in Earl's Court for just a night. We needed somewhere convenient at a good price. The Oxford fit the bill. The double room we had was small (no cat swinging here!), but adequate for a short stay. The bathroom (shower room) was functional and clean. The room also had complimentary: tea/coffee making facilities, hairdryer, tv, a fridge and a safe. The breakfast was very basic (toast, cornflakes, tea/coffee), but at least gets your day started. The hotel is really conveniently located. It is LESS than 5 minutes walk to Earl's Court tube station. There are corner shops, metro supermarkets, etc in easy reach too! The hotel has been renovated fairly recently, but it doesn't take long to notice that it was a cheap and chearful job ..... there was an inch and a half gap under our door (huh!?), a rather dangerous step into the bathroom, a leaky shower cubicle and a cupboard that had been fitted and refitted - leaving the holes from the first fitting! :-) None of these little things were worth worrying about and did not hamper our stay. BUT ... if you want a clean, friendly and functional place to put your head down for a night or two ..... then THIS IS AMPLE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Amydillo
Reviews.Content: We arrived after check-in time and were checked in quickly without any problems. Staff were very polite and helpful. Our room (314) was supposed to be a double but was just two singles pushed together but this wasn't a major issue. Room was clean with a safe and a fridge and a small space for clothes. Tea and coffee facilities were good. Overall excellent if a little on the small side. We only stayed one night and didn't stay for breakfast but there were plenty of places to eat in the Earls Court and Kensington area. Hotel supplied a guide book of the room and local attractions which I thought was a nice touch. A good place to go and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it even at half the price”
Reviews.Author: Seahorsy
Reviews.Content: The room was not ready at check-in time, which was surprising given that it was so small it would have taken 5 minutes to clean. The room only just fitted a double bed in. The bed cover looked grimy. The windowless room had an aircon but it didn't work well. Bathroom minute, with no separate shower, just a shower head above the toilet ( talk about taking care of two items of business at once! ) I had to mop the floor with a towel after my shower ( area so tiny I couldn't wash my hair properly without smacking my elbows on the wall ), because the smooth black tiles became very slippery and dangerous. A continental breakfast was actually bread that you toast yourself in a temperamental old toaster, fake orange juice, instant coffee and an large open bucket of cornflakes. A two pound breakfast at any fast food place would have been better. I heard other guests complaining about issues, so it wasn't just an isolated incident, in my case. The final insult was that I requested to leave my suitcase there for a couple of hours, between the time of my flight and check-out. They actually charged me five pounds, for one small cabin bag! Surely this should be a courtesy service! I've stayed in hotels all around the world and never experienced this. I've stayed in hotels that cost much less, and offer much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great room!”
Reviews.Author: CrissyK
Reviews.Content: We were not sure what to expect (would we have our own bathroom?) when we booked the big room for 4 people. Just coming from a cruise, we were worried. But the room was big and airy, with high ceilings and lots of light from the big windows. It has it's own bathroom which was clean. The hotel was in a great location - across the street from Hyde Park and down the street from shopping. Tube station is nearby. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only downside is that it's excellent location makes for a noisy street, and in the summer the windows need to be open. And freeze-dried coffee. All in all, a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gracie2762
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here for 3 nights and had a great time. We were traveling with 3 people and were able to get a room with 4 twin beds (hard to come by in London). The room had a full bathroom, a TV, a fridge, a microwave and a hot pot to make coffee and tea. They also have a free continental breakfast from 7:30a.m. to 9:30a.m. which was basically coffee, tea, juices and some type of roll or croissaint. We only hit up the continental breakfast once since we were so busy with tours. It was in a nice location only about two blocks from the Lancaster Gate tube stop. They also let us leave our bags there after check out for no additional fee. There is a great Italian restaurant on the same block called Taormino's and there's a convenience store there as well. There's an internet cafe called Video Cafe on a side street that has a printer which worked out great for us so we were able to check in to our departing flight.

Reviews.Title: “beware of extra charges”
Reviews.Author: yoannge
Reviews.Content: In all hotels I've been , leaving your luggage at the reception after checking out is part of the service ,but not so at Oxford hotel where they will charge you an extra 5 quids per room for what they call an extra service .As for the breakfast,the room is so cramped that we went elswhere to get one .

Reviews.Title: “absolutely not!”
Reviews.Author: Mellyscookies
Reviews.Content: don't mistreat yourself!! it's a bad place with small bedroom. we were on the third 4th floor (i think) and there's no elevator!!!!! the room is as big as the queen size bed. next time I'll go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: careeralien
Reviews.Content: I wanted a cheap hotel for one night and the Oxford hotel was fine. The room was small (I was on my own so this was okay but I certainly wouldn't have wanted to share it) but it was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and there was plenty of hot water for a shower, even at 6am. The staff were polite and helpful. There was some maintenance work going on in reception during the afternoon I arrived but it caused no disruption to me. The lift is small and the stairs and corridors are narrow (this is a converted town house afterall) so it may be difficult to get large, heavy items of luggage up to the rooms, but not impossible.
